qas.question: What first person from the USSR controlled their own spacecraft?
Gherman Titov from the USSR drove his own spacecraft on what date?
Radio communication was possible between which two spacecrafts in August 11 and 12, 1962?

context: <a0_0>Gherman Titov<a0_0/> became the first Soviet cosmonaut to exercise manual control of his Vostok 2 craft on <a1_0>August 6, 1961<a1_0/>. The Soviet Union demonstrated 24-hour launch pad turnaround and the capability to launch two piloted spacecraft, <a2_0>Vostok 3 and Vostok 4<a2_0/>, in essentially identical orbits, on August 11 and 12, 1962. The two spacecraft came within approximately 6.5 kilometers (4.0 mi) of one another, close enough for radio communication. Vostok 4 also set a record of nearly four days in space. Though the two craft's orbits were as nearly identical as possible given the accuracy of the launch rocket's guidance system, slight variations still existed which drew the two craft at first as close to each other as 6.5 kilometers (3.5 nautical miles), then as far apart as 2,850 kilometers (1,540 nautical miles). There were no maneuvering rockets on the Vostok to permit space rendezvous, required to keep two spacecraft a controlled distance apart.
